Summary of Progress Note:

The patient is a 69-year-old male with a medical history of coronary artery disease (CAD) post three-vessel coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), left and right carotid artery stenosis with carotid endarterectomy (CEA) x 2 in [**Country 2032**], peripheral vascular disease (PVD), and bilateral renal artery stenosis treated with stents. The patient was admitted for an elective redo-redo right CEA due to a previous stroke with residual right-sided deficits and non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI).

- Blood pressure: 131/58 mmHg (126/53-157/63 mmHg)

   ventricular wall thicknesses are normal. The left ventricular cavity
   size is normal. Overall left ventricular systolic function is low
   normal (LVEF 50%) secondary to hypokinesis of the basal inferior and
   posterior walls. Right ventricular chamber size and free wall motion
   are normal. The aortic valve leaflets (3) are mildly thickened but
   aortic stenosis is not present. No aortic regurgitation is seen. The
   mitral valve leaflets are mildly thickened. There is no mitral valve
   prolapse. Trivial mitral regurgitation is seen. The estimated pulmonary
   artery systolic pressure is normal. There is no pericardial effusion.
   CAROTID US: prelim - Patent right internal carotid, common carotid,
   external carotid and vertebral arteries. Unable to assess for presence
   of flap within the right carotid due to large hematoma and staples from
   prior surgery.
   CXR: prelim - Right mid lung linear atelectasis is new. There is no
   overt CHF. There is mild fluid overload.

Summary:
Summary of Progress Note:
- The patient is a 69-year-old male with a history of coronary artery disease, including three-vessel coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), left and right carotid artery stenosis with carotid endarterectomy (CEA) x 2, peripheral vascular disease (PVD), and bilateral renal artery stenosis treated with stents.
- He was admitted for an elective redo-redo right CEA due to a previous stroke with residual right-sided deficits and non-ST elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI).
- The patient has several medical conditions including hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and tobacco use.
- He is currently receiving multiple medications including aspirin, clopidogrel, atenolol, captopril, simvastatin, ezetimibe, fish oil, and morphine sulfate.
- The patient's vital signs include a temperature of 37.8°C (100.1°F), heart rate of 66 bpm, blood pressure of 159/55 mmHg, respiratory rate of 23 breaths per minute, and oxygen saturation of 97%.
- The patient's cardiac examination shows a normal S1 and S2 heart sounds, with a systolic ejection murmur best heard at the upper sternal borders. No aortic stenosis or regurgitation is seen.
- The patient's lung examination reveals diffuse wheezes, worst on the right side.

Summary:
Based on the provided progress note, here is a summary of the patient's health progress in the ICU:

- The patient is a 69-year-old male with a medical history of coronary artery disease, previous 3-vessel coronary artery bypass graft (CABG), left and right carotid artery stenosis with carotid endarterectomy (CEA) x 2, peripheral vascular disease (PVD), and bilateral renal artery stenosis treated with stents.
- The patient was admitted for an elective redo-redo right CEA due to residual right-sided deficits and non-ST-elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI).
- The patient's current medications include atenolol, captopril, aspirin, clopidogrel, simvastatin, ezetimibe, fish oil, and citalopram.
- The patient's vital signs are relatively stable, with a temperature of 37.8°C (100.1°F), heart rate between 61-69 beats per minute, blood pressure ranging from 159/55-177/70 mmHg, respiratory rate of 23 breaths per minute, and oxygen saturation of 97%.
- The patient's cardiac examination shows a systolic ejection murmur best heard at the upper sternal borders, but no other abnormalities.
- The patient's lung examination reveals right mid lung linear atelectasis, but no overt congestive heart failure (CHF) or fluid
